macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Indices Dip Slightly on January 16
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.06-0.1% to 6,940 points, Dow Jones dropped 0.2% to 49,359, and Nasdaq edged down 0.1% to 23,515, remaining near record highs despite weekly losses. Tech stocks like Alphabet (+2.5%) and semiconductors (Broadcom +2.5%, Micron +7.8%) provided support amid broader market indecision.[1][3]

items.title: Mixed US Labor Data Signals Cooling Demand
items.summary: JOLTS showed a sharp drop in job openings indicating cooling labor demand, ADP reported modest private hiring rebound, and ISM Services PMI surprised higher, pointing to a slowing but resilient economy.[1]

items.title: Regional Banks Deliver Mixed Earnings
items.summary: PNC Financial jumped 3.8% after beating Q4 targets, while Regions Financial fell 2.6% on missed forecasts; larger banks like JPMorgan and Bank of America dropped over 2%.[1][3]

items.title: Treasury Yields Rise as Gold Prices Dip
items.summary: 10-year Treasury yield climbed to 4.23% from 4.17%, 2-year to 3.60% from 3.57%; gold fell 0.6% but up over 5% in January amid safe-haven demand.[3]

items.title: Energy Stocks Mixed on Venezuelan Crude Flows
items.summary: Valero and Marathon Petroleum advanced on renewed Venezuelan crude reports benefiting refiners, while Chevron lagged due to softer crude prices.[1]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: XRP Treasury Firm Evernorth Announces Nasdaq IPO for 2026
items.summary: An XRP-linked firm, Evernorth, holding 388 million XRP tokens, plans to go public on Nasdaq in 2026, joining Kraken, Consensys, and Ledger in a wave of crypto IPOs. Ripple has ruled out an IPO due to its strong balance sheet.

items.title: BlockDAG Faces Scandal with Missing Miners, Unpaid Employees, and Breached Contracts
items.summary: BlockDAG is embroiled in controversy after failing to pay multi-million-dollar sponsorships to at least two football clubs, raising questions about the whereabouts of $442 million in investor funds.

items.title: Crypto Industry Split Over Senate Delay on Clarity Act Vote
items.summary: Prominent crypto figures are divided following the Senate's last-minute delay of a vote on the landmark Clarity Act crypto legislation.

items.title: Goldman Sachs CEO Warns of Major Delays for US Crypto Bill in 2025
items.summary: Goldman Sachs CEO highlights significant hurdles and delays in the 2025 legislative process for a key US crypto bill.

items.title: Binance Research Predicts 2026 as Turning Point for Crypto
items.summary: Binance Research forecasts a more supportive macroeconomic and regulatory environment in 2026, positioning it as a pivotal year for the cryptocurrency sector.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Gartner Predicts Trillion-Dollar AI Spending Surge in 2026
items.summary: Gartner forecasts global AI spending to reach $2.52 trillion in 2026, a 44% increase from 2025, with hyperscalers and vendors funding the boom while enterprises turn to trusted providers like Salesforce for GenAI-integrated solutions.

items.title: AI Demand Sparks Nuclear Power Renaissance
items.summary: Exploding AI data center energy needs, equivalent to hundreds of thousands of households, may revive nuclear power; global leaders discussed at IAEA how nuclear can power AI expansion and AI can innovate nuclear tech.

items.title: Physical AI Emerges as Key Trend Post-Nvidia CES Keynote
items.summary: Jensen Huang's CES 2026 keynote positions Physical AI as the dominant framework for AI automating the physical world, especially in industrial automation and autonomous systems.

items.title: Data Management Evolves for AI Era in 2026
items.summary: AI drives shift to lakehouses, native governance in platforms like Unity Catalog and Snowflake, vector databases, and Apache Iceberg standards, phasing out monolithic warehouses and fragmented stacks.

items.title: Google Cloud Releases Secure AI Framework Guidance
items.summary: Google Cloud's CISO team publishes practical advice on Secure AI Framework (SAIF) for responsible AI building, emphasizing data as perimeter, prompts as code, and identity in agentic AI.

items.title: Claude Cowork Advances Collaborative AI Tools
items.summary: New Claude Cowork tool highlights the future of collaborative AI with advanced transcription and innovative use cases amid 2026's rapid AI evolution.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Facepunch Studios Rust COO Offers to Buy New World for $25 Million
items.summary: The COO of Facepunch Studios, known for Rust, has publicly offered to purchase Amazon's New World MMO for $25 million amid ongoing discussions about the game's future.

items.title: Ubisoft Teases Division 3 with Unchanged Commitment to Franchise
items.summary: Ubisoft has teased The Division 3 while reaffirming support for The Division 2, Survivors, and Resurgence, addressing fan concerns about the franchise's future.

items.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket Launches Mega Latios ex Drop Event
items.summary: Pokémon Trading Card Game Pocket is running a Mega Latios ex drop event from January 16 at 10:00 p.m. PST until January 26 at 9:59 p.m. PST.

items.title: FC26 Sales Top 1 Million Units in Spain YTD 2026
items.summary: EA Sports FC 26 has exceeded 1 million units sold in Spain year-to-date 2026, alongside PS5 sales of 57,500 and Switch 2 at 24,500 units.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Trump Administration Proposes Tech Giants Pay for Surging Power Costs from Data Centers
items.summary: President Trump and several states are pushing for an emergency wholesale electricity auction where tech companies bid on 15-year contracts to fund new power generation for AI data centers. Tech firms like Amazon, Microsoft, and Alphabet are reportedly willing to pay amid rising energy demands.

items.title: Verizon Suffers Major U.S. Service Outage Affecting Millions
items.summary: Verizon experienced a widespread 10-hour outage across the U.S., prompting phones to show SOS mode; the company is offering $20 account credits to 1.5 million affected customers.

items.title: Trump's Chips Proclamation Triggers Sell-Off in Magnificent Seven Stocks
items.summary: Retail investors dumped shares of major tech stocks including Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia following President Trump's proclamation on chips, amid concerns over policy impacts.
